alert.note: Alert for Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Watch issued October 01 at 10:44PM EDT until October 03 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... ...COASTAL FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Watch, one to two feet of inundation above ground level possible in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. For the Beach Hazards Statement, a High Risk for rip currents. * WHERE...Virginia Beach. * WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Watch, from late Sunday night through Monday evening. For the Beach Hazards Statement, through Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...Numerous roads may be closed. Low lying property including homes, businesses, and some critical infrastructure may be inundated. Some shoreline erosion may occur. Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions expected. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. SEWELLS POINT VA MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 4.5 FT, MODERATE 5.5 FT, MAJOR 6.5 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.7 FT, MODERATE 2.7 FT, MAJOR 3.7 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 02/02 AM 3.7 0.9 1.3 1 NONE 02/03 PM 4.3 1.5 1.3 1-2 NONE 03/05 AM 5.4 2.6 3.4 4-5 MINOR 03/04 PM 6.4 3.6 3.5 4 MODERATE 04/04 AM 5.4 2.6 3.1 3-4 MINOR 04/06 PM 5.4 2.6 2.5 2-3 MINOR CHESAPEAKE BAY BRIDGE TUNNEL VA MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 5.0 FT, MODERATE 5.5 FT, MAJOR 6.0 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 2.1 FT, MODERATE 2.6 FT, MAJOR 3.1 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 02/01 AM 3.8 0.9 1.2 2 NONE 02/02 PM 4.7 1.8 1.5 1-2 NONE 03/03 AM 5.4 2.5 2.9 6-7 MINOR 03/03 PM 6.2 3.3 3.0 7 MAJOR 04/03 AM 5.4 2.5 2.9 6-7 MINOR 04/04 PM 5.4 2.5 2.3 6 MINOR LYNNHAVEN INLET VA MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 4.5 FT, MODERATE 5.0 FT, MAJOR 5.5 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.8 FT, MODERATE 2.3 FT, MAJOR 2.8 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 02/02 AM 3.7 1.0 1.5 1 NONE 02/02 PM 4.4 1.7 1.7 1 NONE 03/04 AM 5.4 2.7 3.4 1 MODERATE 03/03 PM 6.1 3.4 3.4 1 MAJOR 04/04 AM 5.4 2.7 3.2 1 MODERATE 04/05 PM 5.4 2.7 2.7 1 MODERATE &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Remain out of the water to avoid hazardous swimming conditions.
